title: Greece remains a big draw for Brits travelling abroad
text:
Greece continues to be a popular tourist spot despite enduring months of economic uncertainty, a new study has found. 
Data from bedbank Hotelbeds reveals that the southern European country is the number three for British travellers. 
The Mediterranean remains the preferred holiday region, with the US ranking second. 
Carlos Munoz, managing director of Hotelbeds, “As the leading source market for Hotelbeds, the British market is a good benchmark for global travel trends. 
“In this regard, our data for the current summer season indicate that it will be another record year for many destinations in the Mediterranean. 
“At Hotelbeds we continue working hard to offer our customers differentiated products and exclusive conditions and the quality of our portfolio certainly reflects the significant improvements we have been making worldwide.” 
The Balearic island of Majorca registers as the top destination with the US following in second. Greece is followed by Turkey, Portugal and Italy in the top destinations ranking for British tourists.
